results.title: Just like dad
results.brief_description: Gemma’s dad, an old rocker from way back, is passionate about music and anything and everything that is remotely connected to music. This addiction comes to a head when dad discovers Ebay on the home computer. Searches and purchases; Ebay has taken over his life. Worse still, Ebay the enemy is now growing on Gemma. She is her father’s daughter! Uses stills and animation.

results.title: Building a bridge: Tajik
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows how, in three days of actual construction, one hundred Tajik men and boys from one village work together to rebuild their hand-construction bridge. No narration.

results.title: Boys' game: Pushtu nomads
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Shows an ancient game, well-known in Asia, being played by Pushtu boys. Demonstrates the toughness of the young men and the value these tribal people place on physical superiority. Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Russell Drysdale
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Five Australians”.
This film shows personal interviews between Russell Drysdale and Australian author George Johnston. Their discussions centre on Drysdale’s slowly developing portrait of Johnston and closely examine the values and lifestyle of what Sidney Nolan calls “the most Australian painter”. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Patience
results.brief_description: A poetic tale of elusive love, of numbness and loss and being shut off from the outside world. Can love be found? An evocative work created through the use of black and white images and an ambient soundtrack.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: The Art of rhyme
results.brief_description:
Ever since a child Mykel has had a fascination for the art of rhyme and a respect for the artistic and creative use of the english language. In this animated piece, he speaks of his dedication to perfecting his art through rap and hip-hop where constant rhyme is no longer a restriction and each syllable and phrase flows into a harmonious melody. “Allowing your mind to be blown away, storming the front of your imagination and pushing it to the limit - that’s the buzz!”
Music by Pabstrakt.

results.title: Train No. 6
results.creator_credit: Daniel Crooks, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Using Melbourne’s urban landscape, ‘Train No.6’ extends Crooks’ exploration of his ‘TimeSlice’ technique. A simple train is reconfigured across time to form mesmerising polyocular images.

results.title: All change please
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Against the Grain” in association with Partners in Grain (PING).
“All change please. That’s what they say when the train is at the last station.” Diana Anderson began her journey around 23 years ago when she moved on to her husband’s family farm in north-west Victoria. Worked on for generations, Diana and Choco improved and changed the farming business, raising their two boys and enjoying the life for almost 23 years. That is until they were confronted with the distressing news the family partnership was to be sold. For Diana this was the end of one journey and the start of another - a new beginning.
